articles.title: Engineering firm told to stop work after crane topples at Universal Studios Singapore - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): An engineering firm has been told to stop work after a crane toppled in the midst of demolition works at Universal Studios Singapore on Saturday (Dec 3) afternoon.

articles.title: Royston Tan's 24 awarded Jury Special Mention at Jogja-Netpac Asian Film Festival - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Singaporean filmmaker Royston Tan has done it again.  His sixth feature film, 24, was given the Jury Special Mention award at the Jogja-Netpac Asian Film Festival on Sunday (Dec 4), with judges praising the work as the "perfect arthouse film".  The film, prod…
articles.content: Using a mise-en-scene storytelling format, Tan and his small crew have "wonderfully made a vignette of life, shown from the perspective of one of the most under-appreciated departments of filmmaking.… [+768 chars]

articles.title: Former Willow head pastry chef brings back forgotten flavours at her own dessert parlour, Catkin - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Soh Hui Shan is reviving the concept of dessert omakase at her parlour, Catkin, which she opened after leaving her job as head pastry chef at Hong Kong Street restaurant Willow.
articles.content: Foodies were shocked when the news broke that Soh Hui Shan had left her job as head pastry chef at the Hong Kong Street restaurant Willow. Since the opening of the charming modern Singaporean restaur… [+2074 chars]

articles.author: Bethany Biron
articles.title: Apple accelerates plans to move production out of China amid protests - Business Insider
articles.description: The company is ramping up efforts to shift manufacturing to other Asian countries like India and Vietnam in order to distance itself from Foxconn.
articles.content:
Apple is pushing to expedite a pivot away from manufacturing in China, as protests swell over the country's strict zero-Covid policies and riots thwart production.

articles.title: Oh Canada! Why is HSBC leaving its fifth biggest market? - South China Morning Post
articles.description: HSBC’s sale of its Canadian business to Royal Bank of Canada for US$10 billion jettisons a business that has been profitable for a decade. What comes next for the UK-based lender as top shareholder Ping An piles on pressure to spin off its Asian operations?
